alert.note: Alert for Clay; Greene (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 10:50PM EST until March 08 at 9:26PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Flatrock River, Eel River. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following waterways in Indiana... East Fork White River, Wildcat Creek, Mississinewa River, Big Blue River, Driftwood River. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue or develop along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers over the next 24 to 48 hours and beyond. River stages are rising again due to the one to over two and a half inches of rain received from Saturday night through this morning. Minor flooding is expected at nearly all locations, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Moderate flooding is being observed Monday evening on the Mississinewa River near Ridgeville in northeast central Indiana. Water is likely on SR 1 just south of SR 28. West CR 825 N east of SR 1 and West River Road west of SR 1 and possibly other county roads are flooded. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eel River at Bowling Green. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.1 feet, Flood water covers both lanes of SR 42 just east of the Eel River. Several county roads are flooded. Persons in river cabins may move cars and possibly belongings to high ground. Poland-Bowling Green Road is impassable on the northeast outskirts of Bowling Green. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Monday was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.3 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Tuesday afternoon by around 1200 PM EST.
